clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the treatment of bacterial infections

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Josamycin is a macrolide antibiotic from i Streptomyces narbonensis i The drug has antimicrobial activity against a wide spectrum of pathogens

incompatibilities.description: The serum concentration of Alfentanil can be increased when it is combined with Josamycin
The serum concentration of Alprazolam can be increased when it is combined with Josamycin
The metabolism of Buspirone can be decreased when combined with Josamycin
The metabolism of Carbamazepine can be decreased when combined with Josamycin
The serum concentration of Cisapride can be increased when it is combined with Josamycin
Josamycin may increase the QTc prolonging activities of Disopyramide
The serum concentration of Estazolam can be increased when it is combined with Josamycin
The serum concentration of Midazolam can be increased when it is combined with Josamycin
The serum concentration of Quinine can be increased when it is combined with Josamycin
The serum concentration of Quinidine can be increased when it is combined with Josamycin
